choices.text: Most common cancer associated with SIADH is small cell carcinoma of lung
Water deprivation is treatment of choice
Vaptans are new FDA approved agents for treatment of SIADH

questions.text: Which of the following statement is false about SIADH :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

•    Most common cancer associated with SIADH is small cell carcinoma of lung

•    Water deprivation is treatment of choice

•    Increased urine osmolarity

•    Vaptans are new FDA approved agents for treatment of SIADH

questions.text: Which of the following sentence is false?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

•   Glucagon stimulates insulin secretion

•   Somatostatin inhibits insulin secretion

•   Insulin inhibits glucagon secretion

choices.text: Morning hyperglycemia due to insufficient insulin
Morning hypoglycemia due to excess insulin

questions.text: Which of the following statements about Dawn phenomenon is true?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Dawn phenomenon is Morning hyperglycemia due to insufficient insulin.

Somogyi effect is Morning hyperglycemia with midnight hypoglycemia.

questions.text: Which of the following is not an indication of haemodialysis in tumor lysis syndrome?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Indications of haemodialysis in tumor lysis syndrome

•	Uric acid > 10 mg/dl

•	Serum Phosphate > 10 mg/dl

•	Serum potassium > 6 meq/l

•	Serum creatinine > 10 mg/dl

questions.text: A 28-year-old man presented with headaches, visual impairment and behavioural changes. Clinically, the patient was found to have hypogonadism and bitemporal hemianopia. A MRI demonstrated a pituitary tumour 1.5 cm in diameter and blood tests revealed a serum prolactin of 700 mcg/L (reference range <20 mcg/L). What should be the first line treatment?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Cabergoline

Medical therapy for pituitary tumors is highly specific and depends on tumor type. For prolactinomas, dopamine agonists are the treatment of choice.

questions.text: Choose the best Lab value for a patient with nephrogenic diabetes insipidus
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

As in nephrogenic DI V2 receptors are defective ADH level increases.

questions.text: In a patient suffering from thyrotoxicosis the thyroid scintigraphy is as shown in the figure the most likely diagnosis is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Toxic Multinodular Goitre

Multiple hyperactive nodules can be seen in figure.

questions.text: A D-xylose test was requested on a patient with history of diarrhoea since 2 months. 5 hour urine sample showed < 4 gm excretion after giving 25 gm of D-xylose. The most likely diagnosis is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

D-xylose test is not a test of pancrease. Bacterial overgrowth syndrome causes fat malabsorption. Celiac sprue damages proximal part of intestine and D-xylose is absorbed from proximal part of intestine. Intestinal lymphangectasia causes fat malabsorption.

choices.text: Mononuclear cell infiltrate in the lamina propria
Periodic acid–Schiff (PAS)–positive macrophages containing small bacilli

questions.text: A 54-year-old man is evaluated by a gastroenterologist for diarrhea that has been present for approximately 1 month. He reports stools that float and are difficult to flush down the toilet; these can occur at any time of day or night but seem worsened by fatty meals. In addition, he reports pain in many joints lasting days to weeks and not relieved by ibuprofen. His wife notes that the patient has had difficulty with memory for the last few months. He has lost 30 pounds and reports intermittent low-grade fevers. He takes no medications and is otherwise healthy. Endoscopy is recommended. Which of the following is the most likely finding on small bowel biopsy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

DIAGNOSIS: WHIPPLE’S DISEASE 

Chronic diarrhea, history of fever, steatorrhoea, dementia and weight loss all are features of WHIPPLE’S DISEASE
“stools that float and are difficult to flush down the toilet and worsened by fatty meals” suggests STEATORRHOEA.
“pain in many joints” suggests arthritis.

choices.text: Noncaseating granuloma throughout the bowel wall
Special stain for Clostridium difficile toxin

questions.text: A 24-year-old woman is admitted to the hospital with a 1-year history of severe abdominal pain and chronic diarrhea that has been bloody for the past 2 months. She reports a 20-lb weight loss, frequent fevers, and night sweats. She denies vomiting. Her abdominal pain is crampy and primary involves her right lower quadrant. She is otherwise healthy. Examination is concerning for an acute abdomen with rebound and guarding present. CT shows free air in the peritoneum. She is urgently taken to the operating room for surgical exploration, where she is found to have multiple strictures and a perforation of her bowel in the terminal ileum. The rectum was spared, and a fissure from the duodenum to the jejunum is found. The perforated area is resected and adhesions lysed. Which of the following findings on pathology of her resected area confirms her diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Chronic bloody diarrhoea, weight loss, fever , night sweats, multiple strictures in intestine, sparing of rectum all suggests CROHN’S DISEASE.

questions.text: A patient has jaundice. Urine for urobilinogen is absent. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Urine for urobilinogen is absent. Means conjugated bilirubin is not able to reach intestine.

questions.text: Antibodies usually elevated in primary biliary cholangitis are
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Antimitochondrial antibody: is most sensitive and most specific antibody for primary biliary cholangitis.

questions.text: All of the following are characteristic neurologic manifestations of Wilson’s disease EXCEPT
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Cognition is not grossly impaired in Wilson’s disease. All others are features.

questions.text: A 61-year-old man is admitted for swelling of the abdomen. You detect ascites on clinical examination and perform a paracentesis. The results show a WBC count of 300 leukocytes/μL with 35% polymorphonuclear cells. The peritoneal albumin level is 1.2 g/dL, protein is 2.7 g/dL, and triglycerides are 320 mg/dL. Peritoneal cultures are pending. Serum albumin is 2.6 g/dL. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: A 40 year old male, known case of cirrhosis develops acute episode of GI bleed. Initial therapy given for 6 hours. Which of the following procedure is useful?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Urgent endoscopy and variceal band ligation is first line treatment for rupture of varices.

questions.text: Diagnostic tests of H. Pylori include all of the following except
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

SAFA test

Soluble Antigen Fluorescent Antibody test is used for diagnosis of pulmonary tuberculosis, rabies.

choices.text: Chronic hepatitis B infection with high infectivity
Acute hepatitis infection with high infectivity
Chronic hepatitis infection with low infectivity
Acute hepatitis infection with low infectivity

questions.text: A 30 year old man presented with nausea, fever and jaundice of 5 days duration. The biochemical tests revealed a bilirubin of 6.7 mg/dl (Conjugated 5 mg/dl) with AST 900 IU/ml and ALT 1400 IU/ml. The serological tests showed the presence of HBsAg, IgM anti HBC and HBeAg. The most likely diagnosis is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Acute hepatitis infection with high infectivity.

presence of -

HBsAg- infection is present

IgM anti HBC - Acute infection

HBeAg - with high infectivity

questions.text: Microalbuminuria is defined as
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

30	– 300  mg per 24 hour urine collection.

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding type 2 respiratory failure?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

High PaCo2 – As type 2 respiratory failure is hypoventilation PaO2 decreases and PaCo2 increases.

questions.text: Shifting dullness on percussion of chest is a characteristic feature of
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Hydropneumothorax - Shifting dullness on percussion of chest

Ascites - Shifting dullness on percussion of abdomen.

questions.text: All of the following are typical auscultatory finding in mitral stenosis EXCEPT
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Ejection systolic murmur

MS is a defect in a forward flow from LA to LV. This flow occur during diastole. So murmur is diastolic.

questions.text: Which of the following combination of cardiac condition and its murmur is wrong-
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Aortic regurgitation has early diastolic murmur.

questions.text: Polycystic kidney disease may have cyst in all of the following organs EXCEPT
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Cysts are not seen in brain and lungs in polycystic kidney disease.

questions.text: All are seen in ARDS except
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

ARDS is type 1 respiratory failure. CO2 washes out and PaCO2 decreases.

questions.text: The causative organism of rheumatic heart disease associated with rheumatic fever are
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Beta hemolytic streptococci

questions.text: Most common renal stone is-
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Most common renal stone is Calcium oxalate dihydrate.

questions.text: Which of the following is not included in Vital capacity of lung?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Residual volume

Maximum volume of air that can be expired after maximum full inspiration called as vital capacity.

choices.text: Block the action of humoral mediator

questions.text: In bronchial asthma, glucocorticoids
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Reduce airway inflammation

questions.text: Tracheal shift to opposite side is seen in
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Pleural effusion

questions.text: “Rose spot” is  a clinical feature of
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

“Rose spot” is  a clinical feature of Enteric fever. It faint salmon colored blanching maculopaular rash on trunk and chest.

questions.text: Koplik’s spot is a feature of
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Rubeola

Koplik’s spot are seen in measles. It is also called as Rubeola.

questions.text: Kimmelstiel-Wilson disease is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Nodular glomerulosclerosis which is a characteristic feature of diabetic nephropathy.

choices.text: Tip of nose is mainly a site of central cyanosis
Central cyanosis occurs in tetralogy of Fallot
It is the relative, rather than the absolute quantity of reduced hemoglobin that is important in producing cyanosis
Presence of Methemoglobin can produce cyanosis

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding cyanosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

A-false, B- false, C-false, D-true

Reference Harrison

The increase in the quantity of reduced hemoglobin in the mucocutaneous vessels that produces cyanosis may be brought about either by an increase in the quantity of venous blood as a result of dilation of the venules. In general， cyanosis becomes apparent when the concentration of reduced hemoglobin in capillary blood exceeds 40 g/L (4 g/dL).

choices.text: Pulsus Parvus et Tardus is a feature of Aortic regurgitation
Pulsus alternas is feature of left ventricular systolic dysfunction.
Pulsus paradoxus is a feature of cardiac tamponade.
Character of pulse is best appreciated at carotid level.

questions.text: Which of the following is false statement regarding different characters of pulse?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

A- false,  B-True, C-True, D-True

Reference Harrison 
 
A small and delayed upstroke (parvus et tardus) is consistent with severe AS.

Chronic severe AR is accompanied by several peripheral signs of significant diastolic run-off， including a wide pulse pressure， a "water-hammer" carotid upstroke (Corrigan'spulse).

choices.text: Kussmaul’s sign is increase in JVP with inspiraton.
It is seen in massive constrictive pericarditis, restrictive cardiomyopathy and right ventricular infarction.
It is seen in COR PULMONALE.
It is seen in massive pulmonary embolism.

questions.text: Which of the following is false regarding Kussmaul’s sign-
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

A-True, B-True, C-False, D-True

Reference Harrison

1-Y, 2-Z, 3-X, 4-W

questions.text:
Arrange the following waves of JVP in sequence of occurrence 

1. ‘y’ Descent 

2. ‘V’ wave 

3. ‘a’ wave

4. ‘c’ wave
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

3→4→2→1

questions.text:
Sequence for absorption of fat

1. Emulsion droplets

2. Chylomicron

3. Fat globules

4. Micelle
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Triglycerides → fat globules → emulsion droplets → fatty acid → Micelle →Triglyceride → chylomicron → Lymph
